channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Trump at briefing says Covid crisis 'will probably unfortunately get worse before it gets better'
See video of Trump just hours after mask tweet
item.description: President Trump tweeted a rare photo of himself in a face mask after struggling in the polls, but just hours later he was seen in public without one.

item.title: More than 64,000 new daily coronavirus infections recorded in the US
Preliminary magnitude 7.8 earthquake strikes off coast of Alaska
item.description: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.8 struck off the coast of Alaska early Wednesday morning.

item.title: Texas Covid-19 hot spot is facing a 'tsunami' of patients, overwhelming hospitals
item.description: Jessica Ortiz said she and her twin brother, Jubal, were inseparable. Even when Jubal lay dead in an open casket with plexiglass over his body -- out of fear he could still be contagious with coronavirus -- she couldn't help but lean down and touch him at his viewing earlier this month.

item.title: One of the original 'Rosie the Riveters' is now making masks to help defeat coronavirus
item.description: One of the original "Rosie the Riveters" is serving her country once more.

item.title: 80 years later, China won't forget what these American pilots did
item.description: Consider this job offer:

item.title: Mars is the latest arena in the US-China rivalry, with both countries launching probes this month
item.description: Two years after humans last landed a probe on Mars, both the United States and China are launching missions to the red planet this month and setting up a new arena for their growing rivalry.

item.title: 43 federal arrests in Portland since July 4, federal officials say
item.description: There have been 43 federal arrests in Portland, Oregon, where there's been unrest in a portion of the city, since July 4, acting Homeland Security Secretary Chad Wolf said Tuesday.

item.title: Adorable photos released as Prince George turns 7
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge released two photos of Prince George to mark his seventh birthday on Wednesday.

item.title: Biden says he's considering four Black women to be his running mate
Crucial Covid-19 vaccine trials underway in South Africa
item.description: The initial results for the Oxford vaccine have been promising, but researcher say the real test for the experimental vaccine will come in South Africa. CNN's David McKenzie goes inside the Johannesburg arm of the study, where scientists are trying to enroll 2,000 participants in the middle of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Doctor explains why he did not use swabs on 2 patients who later died
item.description: Doctor Frank LoVecchio tells CNN's John Berman that due to an ongoing supply shortage, he and his staff ration swabs and other items while seeing Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Twitter cracks down on QAnon accounts
item.description: Twitter is cracking down on accounts linked to QAnon, a group known for spreading conspiracy theories and disinformation online.

item.title: Scientists are one step closer to delaying aging
item.description: Getting old is inevitable, but scientists at the University of California San Diego (UCSD) may be one step closer to being able to delay the aging process.

item.title: China's latest starfish-shaped airport set to boost tourism in northeast
item.description: Qingdao, a Chinese coastal city famous for being the headquarters of Tsingtao Brewery, is poised for a major tourism boost with the completion of the new Qingdao Jiaodong International Airport.

item.title: Trump blasts Beijing in public, but privately Trump org imports tons of Chinese goods
The truth about Trump's cognitive test
item.description: President Donald Trump's latest job qualification, according to President Trump, is not having dementia. In an interview with Fox News' Chris Wallace on Sunday, in which the journalist told Trump that according to recent polling more Americans believe former Vice President Joe Biden is more mentally fit to serve as president than Trump is, Trump trotted out a brag he's shared several times over the past few months: that he aced a test. Namely, the Montreal Cognitive Assessment Test, a cognitive screening test for memory loss or early dementia.

item.title: Ex-White House coordinator lists Trump's 3 'big mistakes' on virus
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to former White House Ebola response coordinator Ron Klain about the Trump administration's mistakes on the handling of coronavirus compared to Europe.

item.title: 11 billion years of history in one map: Astrophysicists reveal largest 3D model of the universe ever created
item.description: A global consortium of astrophysicists have created the world's largest three-dimensional map of the universe, a project 20 years in the making that researchers say helps better explain the history of the cosmos.

item.title: Reporter says GOP lawmaker called Ocasio-Cortez a f***ing b**** after exchange
item.description: Rep. Ted Yoho, a Florida Republican, got into a heated exchange with Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York on Monday, cursing as he walked away from their conversation. According to an account published in The Hill, Yoho said "f**king bitch" as he walked away.

item.title: Former Starbucks employee arrested for allegedly spitting in police officers' drinks
item.description: A former New Jersey Starbucks employee has been arrested after allegedly spitting in the drinks of law enforcement officers, according to a news release.

item.title: Heavy rain confuses nine years worth of tense talks over world's longest river
NFL star reacts to Trump's 'game is over for me' tweet
item.description: New Orleans Saints safety Malcolm Jenkins discusses how athletes are using their platforms to demand racial equality, despite President Donald Trump's tweet that frowns upon athletes kneeling during the national anthem.

item.title: Two couples include a rare comet in their proposals for a once-in-a-lifetime cosmic engagement
item.description: Two couples had their eyes on the sky when getting engaged, capturing a rare comet the moment the question was popped.

item.title: Convent outside Detroit lost 13 religious sisters to Covid-19 with 12 dying in one month
item.description: Coronavirus spread so quickly through a convent in Michigan that it claimed the lives of 12 sisters in one month, beginning on Good Friday.

item.title: Civil War-era smallpox vaccination kits offer new insights on how the virus was eradicated
item.description: While the race for a Covid-19 vaccine continues, scientists are learning more about the early vaccines used to fight smallpox, the only human infectious disease to be successfully eradicated.

item.title: Barcelona's latest virus outbreak is warning to other cities
item.description: In Barcelona and surrounding areas in Spain's Catalonia region, some 3 million residents are being urged to stay home to curb a major coronavirus outbreak. Almost 3,000 new infections were found over the weekend. CNN's Atika Shubert reports.

item.title: This artist paints portraits of medical workers and captures their exhaustion treating Covid-19 patients
item.description: When the pandemic forced artist and video game developer Steve Derrick to work from home, he found himself with extra time on his hands that he said he did not want to spend watching Netflix or Hulu. When he stumbled on a magazine photo of a nurse who had just spent a long shift treating Covid-19 patients, he decided to paint her with marks from her PPE and all. This led him to paint more than 100 portraits of frontline medical workers and send the paintings to his subjects, free of charge.

item.title: NFL players will honor racism victims with names on helmet decals
item.description: When football season kicks off this fall, NFL players will be wearing helmet decals featuring the names of victims of systemic racism and police violence, a league source said.

item.title: US service member dies in Syria
item.description: A US service member died Tuesday in Syria, according to a military press release.

item.title: He survived Covid-19. But walking a couple of miles is now like running a marathon
item.description: From breathlessness to fatigue to memory loss, many Covid-19 survivors have reported lingering symptoms. Researchers in Italy and the UK are working against the clock to answer the many questions on the virus' long-term effects. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

item.title: At least 14 injured in Chicago funeral home shooting
item.description: Fourteen people were hospitalized after a shoot-out at a funeral in Chicago Tuesday, police said.

item.title: A massive asteroid shower hit Earth and the moon 800 million years ago, study says
item.description: Over the course of Earth's ancient history, our planet has been blitzed with a variety of foreign objects, some of which may have triggered major events shaping this place we now call home.

item.title: Drone footage shows former copper mine turning river orange
item.description: Water from a former copper mine runs into a river in the Russian Ural mountains.

item.title: B-2 Spirit: The $2 billion flying wing
item.description: With its "flying wing" design that makes it almost invisible to radar, the B-2 Spirit bomber is truly a standout among military planes -- and also the world's most expensive, at over $2 billion per aircraft.

item.title: Do you sleep with your eyes open? (You'll be surprised how many of us do)
Mother who lost 2 kids to coronavirus: Take this seriously
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar speaks with Monete Hicks, who lost both her son and daughter to the coronavirus within a span of 11 days, and her niece Darisha Scott.

item.title: Rare yellow turtle discovered
item.description: A farmer in eastern India has found a yellow turtle which experts say is the product of albinism.

item.title: Breaking down what's going on in Portland
item.description: It's classic entrenchment with no end in sight.

item.title: Building a prosthetic arm with Lego
item.description: Ever since he was a kid, David Aguilar was obsessed with Lego. He spent his childhood building cars, planes, helicopters, and eventually, his own prosthetic. Born with a deformed arm, the self-named "Hand Solo" decided to take his Lego-building skills to the next level. At age 18, he perfected his designs with the MK2, a prosthetic arm with the ability to bend and pick up objects with a pincer-like grip. Now, he's the coolest kid on the block.

item.title: Ramps leading into temples show Ancient Greeks put inclusive design into action
item.description: Ancient Greek temples, some around 2,500 years old, were built with disability ramps to improve access for visitors, a new study has revealed.

item.title: 96-year-old Flying Tiger crew chief returns to the sky
item.description: Frank Losonsky was a crew chief for the Flying Tigers in World War II and recently flew in one of the iconic planes.

item.title: Trump says pandemic will probably get worse before it gets better
item.description: • Live updates: Almost 900,000 new Covid-19 cases reported last week in the Americas • See video of Trump just hours after mask tweet • Fauci responds to Trump's criticism

item.title: At his first coronavirus briefing since April, Trump repeats a handful of classic false claims
item.description: • Analysis: Trump's return to fronting virus briefings is too little, too late

item.title: Trump comments on Ghislaine Maxwell: 'I wish her well'
item.description: President Donald Trump says he wished Ghislaine Maxwell, the onetime girlfriend and alleged accomplice of accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, well.

item.title: Trump blasts Beijing in public, but privately his properties import tons of Chinese goods
Biden considering four Black women for VP
item.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden said Monday he was considering four Black women to be his running mate, and has been receiving extensive vetting briefings about each potential candidate.

item.title: Photo of second female judge found in car linked to suspect who shot judge's family
item.description: Officials found the name and photo of New York state's chief judge in a car associated with Roy Den Hollander, the man suspected of opening fire on Sunday at another judge's home, according to Lucian Chalfen, the Unified Court System Director of Public Information.
